alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 02 at 2:07PM PST until January 04 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 9 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet with local sets to 12 feet. Dangerous rip currents. Highest surf on west facing beaches, such as Ventura Harbor and Pier. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From 9 AM Wednesday to 9 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minimal coastal flooding risk through Thursday. Another round of high surf will be likely this weekend.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
